intro: Haplopappus pectinatus var. anethifolius, commonly known as the anise-leaved hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, anise-scented leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, pale褐色 pappus structures, aiding in wind pollination. This variety is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
